; I see no parent-child problem, however:
; 8003.1 should be classified as a '<e>3A'.  since it is providing an additional sense to 8003 antaḥpātin.
;  Also, the <hom>a</hom> in 8003 and the <hom>b</hom> in 8003.1 should be removed.
;   I suspect that the '<hom>a</hom>' codes may have been added PRIOR to the integration of supplement with body of text.
;   Before the integration, these two entries would have had different 'neighbors'.
;   But after the integration, they have the same neighbors, so no pseudo-homonym is needed.
;   If this suspicion is right, then we probably should, after doing the current reordering,
;    re-examine all the letter hom codes and remove them where they are now unneeded.

%% The entry "kavya" is missed
; annexure:  I. Kavya (erase I); -havya-bhuj, m. N. of Agni, Kathās.
; 46610: kayya hom=1.
; ? 'erase I' means erase the homonym number at 46610
; There is a homonyn 2 kavya at <L>46625, a denominative verb.
